channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: “Make The Planet A Line Item”: How 1% For The Planet Is Rewiring Corporate Giving
item.description: 1% for the Planet certifies companies donating 1% of revenue to vetted environmental nonprofits—embedding climate giving as a core business commitment...

item.title: Vibe Coding Startup Lovable In Talks To Raise At $6 Billion Valuation
item.description: The Stockholm-based startup that uses artificial intelligence to code apps and websites for its users is in talks to raise a new round at triple its l...

item.title: Walmart Shares Drop As CEO Doug McMillon Announces Retirement
item.description: McMillon will be replaced by John Furner, head of Walmart’s U.S. operations, in January.

item.title: You Can Play The ‘Horizon Steel Frontiers’ MMO On Steam Machine, Not PS5
item.description: Horizon Steel Frontiers will be on PC but not PS5, a bizarre representation of the multi-platform era of video games now.

item.title: 6 Things To Know About Slowing Aging, According To Dr. David Sinclair
item.description: Insights from the Andrew Huberman–David Sinclair podcast on how epigenetics, mitochondria, exercise and lifestyle factors may influence healthy aging.

item.title: Captaincy
item.description: I’m not sure this is the right word for it, but we certainly need one. Not ‘entrepreneurship’ which is a distinct skill. That term is usually reserved...

item.title: Stuck happens
item.description: When the long-term cost of our situation is uncomfortably linked to the short-term expense and pain of changing the situation, it’s easy to feel stuck...

item.title: “We’re up”
item.description: This is the challenging insight that every generation comes to grips with. It might be a rising cohort of teachers or managers. It might be the next c...

item.title: A good business vs. a useful idea
item.description: Ideas open doors, lead to connections and make things better. But not all good ideas are good businesses. Crop rotation is a good idea. So is sous vid...

item.title: The pursuit of wonder
